item.title: Leadership Elasticity: What a 1928 Psychoanalyst Can Teach Us
item.description: “If you want to build a ship, don’t drum up the men to gather wood, divide the work, and give orders. Instead, teach them to yearn for the vast and endless sea.” — Antoine de Saint-Exupéry I keep this quote on my homepage because it captures something fundamental about leading people: it’s not about the mechanics, it’s about connection. Recently I stumbled upon a concept from psychoanalysis that gave me a new lens to think about this, and I want to share it because it maps surprisingly well onto the challenges we face as leaders of people.
